head.title: selector-no-empty
head.description: selector-no-empty Disallow empty selectors. Empty selectors (by themselves or within a selector list) invalidate a rule. This rule splits…

body:
#selector-no-empty

Disallow empty selectors.

  a, , b {}
/** ↑ 
 * An empty selector */

Empty selectors (by themselves or within a selector list) invalidate a rule. This rule splits the selector list on ,. Any part that has zero length or containing only whitespace is deemed empty.

#Options

#true

The following patterns are considered warnings:

{}
, .a, .b {}
.a, .b,  {}
.a, , .b {}

The following patterns are not considered warnings:

a {}
a, b {}
a.foo {}
rawBody:
# selector-no-empty

Disallow empty selectors.

```css
  a, , b {}
/** ↑ 
 * An empty selector */
```

Empty selectors (by themselves or within a selector list) invalidate a rule. This rule splits the selector list on `,`. Any part that has zero length or containing only whitespace is deemed empty.

## Options

### `true`

The following patterns are considered warnings:

```css
{}
```

```css
, .a, .b {}
```

```css
.a, .b,  {}
```

```css
.a, , .b {}
```

The following patterns are *not* considered warnings:

```css
a {}
```

```css
a, b {}
```

```css
a.foo {}
```
raw:
---
title: selector-no-empty
---

# selector-no-empty

Disallow empty selectors.

```css
  a, , b {}
/** ↑ 
 * An empty selector */
```

Empty selectors (by themselves or within a selector list) invalidate a rule. This rule splits the selector list on `,`. Any part that has zero length or containing only whitespace is deemed empty.

## Options

### `true`

The following patterns are considered warnings:

```css
{}
```

```css
, .a, .b {}
```

```css
.a, .b,  {}
```

```css
.a, , .b {}
```

The following patterns are *not* considered warnings:

```css
a {}
```

```css
a, b {}
```

```css
a.foo {}
```
